result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Bolden Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; STRAIGHT TIME
Court orders a referral to Mental Health at the end of defendant's probation

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharges by 05-12-16 or entry of a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.

- Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with Victoria S. The No Contact Order may be modified by the defendant's Agent, if s/he sees fit.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment, school, or combination of both.

timeConds.notes: STRAIGHT TIME; STAYED pending the discretion of the defendant's Agent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Bolden Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Bolden in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court orders stayed warrant lifted.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Defendant sentenced to serve 270 days (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 (one) year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 90 days (STRAIGHT TIME)
          in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed 
          pending the discretion of the defendant's agent.
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with Victoria S. The no-contact order may be modified by the 
          defendant's agent, if s/he sees fit.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharges 
          by 5/12/16 or entry of a civil judgment.
     *   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or.
          combination of both.
     *   No firearms; weapons
 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed

Court orders a referral to mental health at the end of the defendant's probation.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report dated May 11, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for sentencing hearing.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated May 4, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Anthony Bolden in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Court ordered stayed warrant lifted. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37. Court informed defendant to continue to cooperate with Justice Point Program.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Program report dated April 14, 2015; received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report dated April 8, 2015; received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Anthony Bolden in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for jury trial. Defense counsel Daniel Meylink is unavailable for today's proceedings due to jury trial in Branch 38.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report dated April 3, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

15RM013224  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-12-15
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
Court ordered all previously ordered conditions are to remain in effect. DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY.

Defendant Anthony Bolden in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE. Case in court due to Justice Point Program violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant. Court amends cash bail. Defense counsel requests speedy jury trial. Court vacated March 24, 2015 at 8:30 a.m. projected guilty plea. DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY.  Jury trial scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Program Violation Report - Positive testing; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Anthony Bolden in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Pre-trial conference held.  Court advised defendant of upcoming Justice Point Program appointment.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Program report dated February 13, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. 
Court orders defendants to be monitored by drug testing.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Victoria S.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony Bolden in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  
Defendant Anthony Bolden in custody.  
Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
